str2: One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(lit: an evil-worker), a criminal. From kakos and the base of ergon; a wrong-doer, i.e. Criminal.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To hang, hang up, suspend; mid: To be hanging, hang. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to hang.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From blasphemos; to vilify; specially, to speak impiously.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
By no means, not at all. Intensive of ou; not indeed.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 2nd Person Singular
Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
